body_html:
With the current graph semantics it's essentially impossible.
…
On Fri, Oct 13, 2017 at 7:51 AM, Artem Artemev ***@***.***> wrote: @alextp <https://github.com/alextp>, that's right. In fact, it was a feature request - to be able to recompute the tensor and introduce property which generates this operation. I'm sorry if it wasn't clear from previous messages That would be super useful in while_loop-like flow statements. The solution which you proposed doesn't work for me, as I do have control on input tensors x and f, and I do not know what's inside f. How hard is it to implement re-computation operation for tensor? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. -- - Alex

 which generates this operation. I'm sorry if it wasn't clear from previous

body:
With the current graph semantics it's essentially impossible.

On Fri, Oct 13, 2017 at 7:51 AM, Artem Artemev <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @alextp <https://github.com/alextp>, that's right. In fact, it was a
> feature request - to be able to recompute the tensor and introduce property
> which generates this operation. I'm sorry if it wasn't clear from previous
> messages That would be super useful in while_loop-like flow statements.
>
> The solution which you proposed doesn't work for me, as I do have control
> on input tensors x and f, and I do not know what's inside f.
>
> How hard is it to implement re-computation operation for tensor?
>
